sub.name: Maruti Suzuki Ignis
sub.details: The Maruti Suzuki Ignis is a revolutionary car by Maruti Standards trying to bring a fresh design philosophy in the bare-bones hatchback segment in India. Aimed at the millennials, the Ignis was first showcased as the Suzuki iM-4 concept at the 2015 Geneva Motor Show and later unveiled at the 2015 Tokyo Motor Show.

sub.name: Hyundai Elite
sub.details: The second-gen i20 facelift gets Hyundai’s latest family grille and carries forward the same 1.2-litre petrol and 1.4-litre diesel engine. A CVT auto will be offered with the petrol from May 2018 Reviews Hyundai has launched the 2018 Elite i20 facelift at the ongoing Auto Expo 2018 in Greater Noida

sub.name: BMW
sub.details: BMW has currently 12 cars on sale for the Indian market. BMW offers 4 SUVs, 6 Sedans, 1 Convertibles and 1 Hybrids. While the BMW X1 is most affordable SUV starting at Rs 34.5 Lakh, the BMW 3 Series is most affordable Sedans starting at Rs 39.8 Lakh, the BMW Z4 is most affordable Convertibles starting at Rs 81.8 Lakh, the BMW i8 is most affordable Hybrids starting at Rs 2.62 Cr. Also, the BMW i8 is the most expensive BMW car with a price tag of Rs 2.62 Cr. The BMW i8 is the latest offering from BMW with a starting price of Rs 2.62 Cr and the upcoming BMW Cars include the i8, M2, X7, X4, 3 Series 2019, 4 Series, X5 2019, X2, 8 Series, i3.
